workflow.name: Automated Interview Tracker with Google Calendar, Sheets & Gmail Alerts
workflow.description:
Enhance your hiring pipeline by automating interview management post-screening. This workflow runs every 5 minutes to scan upcoming Google Calendar events, filter relevant interviews, send timely email reminders to candidates and internal teams, and handle result submissions via webhook ‚Äî updating statuses in Google Sheets and notifying via Gmail based on pass/fail outcomes. Ensure no interviews slip through the cracks with proactive reminders and instant feedback loops.

---

### What This Template Does  

**Step 1:** Triggers **every 5 minutes** to proactively check for upcoming interviews. 
**Step 2:** Fetches all **Google Calendar Events** and identifies interview-related ones.  
**Step 3:** **Filters Upcoming Interviews** based on event details (e.g., candidate name, role).  
**Step 4:** Sends **Reminder Emails** to candidates and interviewers via Gmail for preparation.  
**Step 5:** Receives **Webhook Submission** of interview results (pass/fail) post-event.  
**Step 6:** **Updates Google Sheet** with result data, including feedback and updated status.  
**Step 7:** Branches on result:  
‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚Üí **Passed:** Sends congratulatory **Email to Candidate** and advances status.  
‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‚Üí **Failed:** Sends polite **Failure Notification** and closes the loop.  

---

### Key Benefits  
‚úÖ Reduces no-shows with automated reminders  
‚úÖ Centralizes interview tracking in Google Sheets  
‚úÖ Instant Gmail notifications for pass/fail decisions  
‚úÖ Minimizes manual status updates  
‚úÖ Improves candidate experience with timely communication  
‚úÖ Ensures audit-ready logs of all interactions  

---

### Features  
- Cron-triggered checks every 5 minutes  
- Google Calendar integration for event fetching  
- Smart filtering for interview-specific events  
- Gmail-powered reminder and notification emails  
- Webhook for secure result submissions  
- Conditional branching on pass/fail  
- Real-time Google Sheets append/update  
- Comprehensive sheet structure for tracking  

---

### Requirements  
- **GOOGLE_SHEET_ID**: Your Google Sheet ID (structured as below)  
- **Credentials Needed:**  
  1. Google Calendar OAuth2  
  2. Gmail API Key  
- **Customize:**  
  ‚Ä¢ Event filter criteria (e.g., keywords like "Interview")  
  ‚Ä¢ Reminder timing (e.g., 24 hours before)  
  ‚Ä¢ Email templates for reminders and results  
  ‚Ä¢ Webhook endpoint for result submission  

**Google Sheet Structure:**  
1. Create a sheet with columns:  
   - Candidate Email  
   - Interview Link  
   - Status  
   - Result  
   - Meet Link  
   - Feedback  
   - Updated At  

---

### Target Audience  
- Recruiters juggling multiple interview schedules üóìÔ∏è  
- HR teams focused on candidate engagement üí¨  
- Hiring managers needing quick result turnarounds ‚ö°  
- Growing companies scaling interview volumes üìà  
- Remote teams relying on calendar and email sync üåê  

---

### Step-by-Step Setup Instructions  

1. **Set up Google Sheet**  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Create sheet with the specified columns: Candidate Email, Interview Link, Status, Result, Meet Link, Feedback, and Updated At.  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Replace `YOUR_SHEET_ID` in the workflow with your actual Sheet ID.  

2. **Configure Calendar Integration**  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Connect Google Calendar OAuth2 and select the relevant calendar (e.g., hiring@company.com).  

3. **Define Event Filters**  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí In the "Filter Upcoming Interviews" node, set keywords (e.g., "Candidate Interview") to match event titles/descriptions.  

4. **Customize Reminders**  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Edit the "Send Reminder to Candidate" template (e.g., include interview link and prep tips).  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Set reminder offset (e.g., 1 day before event).  

5. **Set Up Webhook for Results**  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Generate and expose the webhook URL for your interview form/tool to submit pass/fail data.  

6. **Connect Gmail**  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Enable Gmail OAuth2.  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Define sender email and customize pass/fail templates.  

7. **Test the Flow**  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Create a test calendar event for an upcoming interview.  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Wait 5 minutes or trigger manually ‚Üí Verify reminder email.  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Submit test webhook result ‚Üí Check sheet update and notification email.  

8. **Go Live**  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Enable the 5-minute cron trigger.  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Monitor sheet for real entries on Thursday, October 23, 2025, or your next interview day.

Interview Result

Thank you for taking the time to interview with us.

After careful consideration, we have decided not to move forward with your application at this time.

Feedback: {{ $json.feedback }}

We wish you all the best in your future endeavors.

Best regards,
HR Team
parameters.subject: Interview Result

parameters.content:
## Workflow Overview

- **Check Every 5 Minutes**: Triggers the workflow to run every 5 minutes.
- **Get Calendar Events**: Retrieves upcoming interview events from Google Calendar.
- **Filter Upcoming Interviews**: Filters the retrieved events to focus on upcoming interviews.
- **Add to Google Sheet**: Appends filtered interview details to a Google Sheet.
- **Send Reminder to Candidate**: Sends an email reminder to the candidate via Gmail.

## Workflow Overview

- **Webhook: Submit Interview Result**: Receives interview result data via a webhook.
- **Update Sheet with Result**: Updates the Google Sheet with the submitted interview result.
- **Check if Passed**: Evaluates whether the interview result indicates a pass or fail.
- **Email Candidate - Passed**: Sends a pass notification email to the candidate via Gmail.
- **Email Manager**: Sends an email update to the manager via Gmail.
- **Email Candidate - Failed**: Sends a fail notification email to the candidate via Gmail.

user.name: Oneclick AI Squad
user.bio: The AI Squad Initiative is a pioneering effort to build, automate and scale AI-powered workflows using n8n.io. Our mission is to help individuals and businesses integrate AI agents seamlessly into their daily operations  from automating tasks and enhancing productivity to creating innovative, intelligent solutions. We design modular, reusable AI workflow templates that empower creators, developers and teams to supercharge their automation with minimal effort and maximum impact.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
